while in erie

Keystone DH 2024 @ Penn State Erie, The Behrend College

Want to explore the area during your visit? Here is your one stop shop to all things you have to do and/or try during your time in Erie, Pennsylvania!

Places

Erie Art Museum

Erie's Art Museum is the perfect place to experience remarkable art pieces from both local and world-famous artists. With over 8,000 objects, there is something for everyone to enjoy.

Website: https://www.erieartmuseum.org/

Phone: (814) 459-5477

Address: 20 East 5th Street, Erie, PA 16507

Hours:

  • Sat: 10:00AM-5:00PM
  • Sun: 1:00PM-6:00PM
  • Mon-Tue: Closed
  • Wed-Fri: 11:00AM-6:00PM

FEED Media Arts Center

Downtown Erie's prime destination for innovation, exhibition, education, and preservation of media art. Experience their collections, including Eclipsing Stars, Ether.exe, or Mirror Me!

Website: https://blog.feed.art/

Phone: +1 (814) 240-1080

Address: 1307 State St, Erie, PA 16501

Hours:

  • Wed. May 22 (after the conference): 2 - 4pm
  • Fri: 5:00PM-8:00PM
  • Sat-Sun: 12:00PM-5:00PM

The Waterfront and Presque Isle

Visit the lakefront in downtown Erie, and make a trip out on the peninsula of Presque Isle! Check out these 15 recommended activities at Presque Isle from travel site Uncovering PA.

Food

Erie Brewing Company and John's Wildwood pub & pie (at Knowledge Park near campus)

Located close to the Penn State Behrend campus, the Erie Brewing Company is a local favorite, with some amazing beverages brewed on site, from craft sodas to ales, IPAs, to stouts. You can take a tour of the brewery, and also order pizza, Buffalo wings, hoagies (all loved in this region) from John's Wildwood pub & pie restaurant next door / attached. This is where Behrend people (of age) go to celebrate surviving a tough week!

Knowledge Park location

  • 6008 Knowledge Pkwy, Erie, PA 16150
  • Hours:
    • Monday - Thursday: 11:30am - 10pm
    • Friday - Saturday: 11:30am - 11pm
    • Sunday: 11:30am - 9:30pm

The Brewerie (at Union Station, downtown Erie)

Erie's first craft brew pub, located in our historic train station, visited on whistle stop tours by several presidents as well as sports icons Babe Ruth and Jack Dempsey! They say the station is haunted by the ghosts of past travelers, but we just love the food and craft beverages at the Brewerie as a fine experience of Erie.

  • 123 W 14th Street, Erie, PA 16501-1717
  • Hours:
    • Monday-Thursday 11:30-9pm
    • Friday & Saturday 11:30-11pm
    • Closed Sundays & All Major Holidays

Erie Food Co-op and Co-op Cafe

Community-owned grocery store and deli with sit-down cafe. (No membership required.) There are two locations in Erie, but the one with the cafe is on 26th street.

Address and Hours

  • 1341 W. 26th Street, Erie, PA 16508
  • Mon - Sat 8am - 8pm, Sun 10am - 8pm

Saras

Website: https://sarasandsallys.com/

Phone: (814) 833-1957'

Address: 25 Peninsula Dr, Erie, PA 16505

Hours

  • Every Day: 11:00AM-8:00PM

Hungry and looking for a place to eat? Try Sara's, located next to Presque Isle State Park. With lovely outdoor seating, you can enjoy the (hopefully) warm weather while trying on their tasty milkshakes or ice cream!

Stanganelli’s Italian Food

Ever heard of Erie's iconic Pepperoni Balls? Their claim to fame comes from Stanganelli's, a family owned Italian restaurant. Not a fan of pepperoni? Not a problem! They also have amazing calzones, meatballs, various pastas, sauces, and assorted breads.

Website: https://www.stanganellis.com/

Phone: 814-459-0101

Address: 1621 West 26th Street, Erie, PA 16508

Hours:

  • Sun-Mon: Closed
  • Tue-Fri: 11:00AM-6:00PM
  • Sat: 11:00AM-4:00PM

Romolo Chocolates

Romolo Chocolates is the perfect place to add to your to-do list. For over 28 years, they have been making their delicious deserts to satisfy every person's sweet tooth. Be sure to try their famous and uniquely crafted Sponge Candy, which continues to be a fan favorite of Erieites and tourists alike!

Website: https://romolochocolates.com/

Phone: 814-452-1933

Address: 1525 West 8th Street, Erie, PA 16505

Hours:

  • Mon-Fri: 8:00AM-8:00PM
  • Sat: 9:00AM-8:00PM
  • Sun: 10:00AM-5:00PM

Smith's Hot Dogs

Although there is no specific restaurant in Erie with this, Smith's hot dogs are Erie's favorite! From Smith Provision Co., Inc., their skillfully crafted weiners, sausages, deli meats, bacon and hams have been a staple in Erie culture for four generations. You can buy these at most restaurants that serve hot dogs or grocery store!

Keystone DH 2024 at Penn State Erie, The Behrend College
